adm:managed-object.name: error-log-publisher
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis: are responsible for distributing error log messages from the error logger to a destination.
adm:managed-object.adm:description: Error log messages provide information about any warnings, errors, or significant events that are encountered during server processing.

adm:property.name: java-class
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
The fully-qualified name of the Java class that provides the
implementation.

adm:property.name: default-severity
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the default severity levels for the logger.

adm:value.name: all
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Messages of all severity levels are logged.

adm:value.name: none
adm:value.adm:synopsis: No messages of any severity are logged by default. This value is intended to be used in conjunction with the override-severity property to define an error logger that will publish no error message beside the errors of a given category.

adm:value.name: fatal-error
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for messages that provide information about fatal errors which may force the server to shut down or operate in a significantly degraded state.

adm:value.name: info
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for messages that provide information about significant events within the server that are not warnings or errors.

adm:value.name: mild-error
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for messages that provide information about mild (recoverable) errors encountered during processing.

adm:value.name: mild-warning
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for messages that provide information about mild warnings triggered during processing.

adm:value.name: notice
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for the most important informational messages (i.e., information that should almost always be logged but is not associated with a warning or error condition).

adm:value.name: severe-error
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for messages that provide information about severe errors encountered during processing.

adm:value.name: severe-warning
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for messages that provide information about severe warnings triggered during processing.

adm:value.name: debug
adm:value.adm:synopsis: The error log severity that is used for messages that provide debugging information triggered during processing.

adm:property.name: override-severity
adm:property.adm:TODO: This should be split into per-category properties whose value defaults to the default-severity. See issue 2503.
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the override severity levels for the logger based on the category of the messages.
adm:property.adm:description: Each override severity level should include the category and the severity levels to log for that category, for example, core=mild-error,info,mild-warning. Valid categories are: core, extensions, protocol, config, log, util, schema, plugin, jeb, backend, tools, task, access-control, admin, sync, version, quicksetup, admin-tool, dsconfig, user-defined. Valid severities are: all, fatal-error, info, mild-error, mild-warning, notice, severe-error, severe-warning, debug.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: All messages with the default severity levels are logged.

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis: A string in the form category=severity1,severity2...
